text: Dónall Farmer (born Daniel Patrick Farmer; 24 November 1937 – 6 December 2018https://www.rte.ie/entertainment/2018/1206/1015498-glenroe-star-donall- farmer-has-died/) was an Irish television film director, producer, RTÉ Head of Drama (succeeding Chloe Gibson) and actor who performed on stage and in film and television productions. Known for his part in Glenroe, the Irish television series in which he played Father Tim Devereux, he won two Jacob's Awards for his work on RTÉ Television, in 1969 and 1979 respectively.The Irish Times, "Awards for radio and TV presented", 11 December 1969The Irish Times, "Jacobs present awards", 31 March 1979 A notable contributor to stage productions in the Abbey Theatre, his play parts span 1980–1989. ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Role |- | 1992–2000||Glenroe | Fr.
